<abstract>
 <para>This chapter will help you understand what CMIS is, how it is extended in WCM, and its features via the following topics:</para>

          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Dev_CMIS.Overview">Overview</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
          <para>Overview introduction about CMIS, xCMIS and eXo CMIS.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Dev_CMIS.Specification">CMIS specification</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
          <para>Introduction about CMIS specification which provides a Web services interface. </para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Dev_CMIS.xCMIS_project">xCMIS project</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
          <para>Introduction about the xCMIS project and its benefits.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Dev_CMIS.features">CMIS features</link>
          </emphasis></para>
        <para>Introduction about CMIS feartures, such as Integration with eXo WCM, CMIS Domain Model and CMIS Services. </para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="Adm_CMIS.ServiceJARs">Service JARs</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
          <para>Additional information about a list of JARs used in eXo CMIS.</para>

	</abstract>
{docbook}
